title: What's the difference between day and date? - Quora

response.answer_text: Friday is the day (of the week; these repeat every 7 days). The 28th is the date. A Full Date cites the date (of the month), the month and the year. There is an important concept called localization formatting that pertains especially to dates. We in the U.S. use: Monday, May 1, 2017but England writes the exact same date: Monday, 1 May, 2017In the end, the format doesn't matter (just be consistent with local preference if any).
